results.title: Zembla
results.creator_credit: Katrina Salvadore and St Columba's College
results.brief_description: Zembla is a word derived from “zemblanity”, a term coined by the British author William Boyd to mean “the opposite of serendipity”.

results.title: Survival of the fittest
results.creator_credit: Tessa Laing and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: ‘Survival of the Fittest’ constructs the core message that human genetics should not be altered, despite good intentions. Based on a scientific theory by Herbert Spencer that relates to how organisms evolve over time to develop desirable traits. The film explores how scientists can artificially replicate a natural process, which can lead to a negative outcome.

results.title: Time Again: narrative, history and identity in the work of David Bowie
results.brief_description: “How do we make sense of the various characters, stories, cultural echoes and cross-references in the work of David Bowie?” Professor Will Brooker delivers his Keynote presentation at ‘The Stardom and Celebrity of David Bowie’ symposium held at ACMI in July 2015 during the ‘David Bowie is’ exhibition. How can we map the relationship between the identities he adopts within songs, albums and performances, and where does the real life of David Jones figure in this network? This talk begins to sketch a ‘Bowie Matrix’ of chronology and connections, drawing on Mikhail Bakhtin’s theory of the chronotope to track the recurring themes and call-backs in Bowie’s lyrics from the 1960s to the 2010s.

results.title: Unpacking Filmscapes - The Coloured Sky: New Women II

results.brief_description: Yang Fudong’s five-channel video installation, ‘The Coloured Sky: New Women II’ (2014), marks an aesthetic departure from his signature output on 35mm black and white film to vivid colour.

results.title: Time Machine [game trailer]
results.creator_credit: Werner van Niekerk, Cameron Cockrell and Tea Tree Gully Primary School
results.brief_description: ‘Time Machine’ is about robots that take over the world but there is a scientist that builds a robot that will take back the world. So it is your job to get past the boss. When you get past the boss you get a high score and the minions will try to kill you so watch out and have fun. There are bouncing pads that can help you jump higher and get things like health and score and save you too. There is also health which goes down when you are hit by evil robots or fireballs. Health packs increase your health.

results.title: Subconscious Password
results.creator_credit: Chris Landreth, Mark Smith, Marcy Page, Seneca College Animation Arts Centre, Copperheart Entertainment and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Most of us have had at least one of those excruciating social encounters where you can’t remember someone’s name. Just what is your subconscious up to while you frantically try to recall it?
Cast includes: Don McKellar, Ron Pardo, Patrice Goodman, Ray Landry, Tony Daniels, Athena Karkanis, Nanci Pach, Kedar, Denise Oliver, Dwayne Hill, Chris Landreth and John R. Dilworth.
Music: Daniel Janke
Animation direction and layout: Sean Craig

results.title: Visiting Grandpa
results.creator_credit: Ethan Price, Ethan Hawkins, Riley Elson and Luke Breaden
results.brief_description: My name is Mick and I enjoy lots of exciting activities but not the activity of visiting Grandpa every Sunday. That is, until I find a photo album and discover I have more in common with Grandpa than I can imagine. Come and explore how two different people make a connection.
